abstract: Defense in trial of Boston Marathon bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev rests its case after questioning just four witnesses; admits Tsarnaev's guilt but argues he was under his brother Tamerlan's influence.
lead_paragraph: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev’s scant defense reflected a strategy of admitting that while he participated in the 2013 attack, he was less culpable than his brother and did not deserve to die.

headline.main: Defense Rests in Boston Marathon Bombing Trial After Just 4 Witnesses
headline.print_headline: Defense Rests in First Phase of Marathon Bombing Trial After Just Four Witnesses

snippet: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev’s scant defense reflected a strategy of admitting that while he participated in the 2013 attack, he was less culpable than his brother and did not deserve to die.
